subject: Nutrition
title: Rickets The Victorian Plague
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Rickets The Victorian Plague.

hook.text: In Victorian England, children's legs bowed under their own weight. The culprit was smog blocking sunlight.

buildup.text: Rickets softens bones in children due to severe vitamin D deficiency, causing deformities and fractures.

discovery.text: In 1922, researchers proved that cod liver oil and sunlight could cure rickets completely.

twist.text: Rickets has returned in developed countries as children spend more time indoors with screens.

climax.text: Vitamin D fortification of milk in the 1930s nearly eliminated ricketsâ€”until indoor life brought it back.

punchline.text: A disease we defeated is creeping back indoors.
